title: High Vulnerability to Sea Level Rise
description: In 2015, 81.7% of the Marshall Islands' land area was below 5 meters in elevation, making it highly susceptible to sea level rise.

title: Dominance of Food and Beverage Manufacturing
description: In 2021, food, beverages, and tobacco accounted for 98.1% of the value added in manufacturing in the Marshall Islands, highlighting a concentrated industrial sector.

title: Limited Social Insurance Coverage for the Wealthiest
description: In 2019, only 66.2% of the richest quintile in the Marshall Islands were covered by social insurance programs, indicating gaps in social security coverage.

title: High Incidence of Tuberculosis
description: As of 2023, the Marshall Islands reported 692 cases of tuberculosis per 100,000 people, reflecting significant public health challenges.

title: Substantial External Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, the Marshall Islands had an external health expenditure of $455.51 per capita, indicating reliance on international health funding.

title: Lowest Nitrous Oxide Emissions
description: In 2023, the Marshall Islands reported a total nitrous oxide emission of 0.0002 Mt CO2e, one of the lowest globally, indicating minimal contribution to greenhouse gas emissions.

title: High Central Government Debt
description: As of 2019, the central government debt of the Marshall Islands stood at 96,801,972 LCU, reflecting a significant financial burden on the country's economy.

title: Low Household Consumption Expenditure
description: In 2023, household and NPISHs final consumption expenditure was recorded at 183,222,100 US$, indicating limited consumer spending capacity.

title: Minimal Gross Capital Formation
description: The gross capital formation in 2023 was 51,144,300 US$, suggesting low levels of investment in infrastructure and development.

title: Limited Manufacturing Sector
description: In 2021, other manufacturing accounted for only 1.89% of the value added in manufacturing, highlighting a small industrial base.

title: High Dependence on Imports
description: Imports of goods and services in 2023 amounted to 184,750,700 LCU, indicating a high reliance on external sources for goods and services.

title: Low Commercial Service Exports
description: In 2021, commercial service exports were valued at 1,059,451 US$, reflecting a limited presence in the global service market.

title: Few Children Out of School
description: In 2022, only 15 primary school-aged girls were out of school, showcasing strong educational participation among young females.
